body: I'm for it, but I would like to have more transparency (maybe make it public?) because it feels like on Reddit, half the time people just use it to harass others and say things they wouldn't say in a public forum.

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body:
Hmmm. What would happen if someone sent another user sensitive information about their own lives that they don't want others knowing about , even on the internet. Or maybe a chatroom for Ruqqus. 

Basically, just to talk to like minded people but in an IRC fashion since discord is not a free speech platform.

body: This could work. XMPP would be an excellent backend for such. It's open source, can be accessed by external software or web client. You can block, etc like IRC, but it's encryptable, has friend lists, etc.
body_html: This could work. XMPP would be an excellent backend for such. It's open source, can be accessed by external software or web client. You can block, etc like IRC, but it's encryptable, has friend lists, etc.

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body: PMs are a pretty standard feature of any public Internet forum. I think it being turned off by default would be best, along with a good blacklisting tool/function to filter unwanted messages, but it needs to happen. People should be responsible enough to police their own internet presence.
body_html: PMs are a pretty standard feature of any public Internet forum. I think it being turned off by default would be best, along with a good blacklisting tool/function to filter unwanted messages, but it needs to happen. People should be responsible enough to police their own internet presence.

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body: Disagree. I think you can have both. It should be that you post on someone's profile and that person is the mod of their profile. Messages start private, then subs, then public. Whenever someone posts to someone, it's with the knowledge that the person they are talking to can take their comments public at any time. This will curb creeps and harrassers and still allow a private message function.
body_html: Disagree. I think you can have both. It should be that you post on someone's profile and that person is the mod of their profile. Messages start private, then subs, then public. Whenever someone posts to someone, it's with the knowledge that the person they are talking to can take their comments public at any time. This will curb creeps and harrassers and still allow a private message function.

body: That does make some sense but I don't see how that system is superior to simply blocking unwanted messengers. Let's say I'm in a private discussion with someone on a controversial topic. I start to win the argument and my opponent, knowing that their point of view is the generally accepted viewpoint, decides to make the entire discussion public. Then I might be subject to harassment from a mob. And if someone is messaging you with things you find distasteful, what would be the point of allowing those messages to continue to reach you? If you find them unpleasant surely you would just want to make them stop.

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body:
Yes we need a secret channel to plot the Broccoli culture war, but I don't see it as a priority compared to other things that take admin and dev bandwidth. Things like
- customizable word lists so that users can be in control of their echo chambers
- transparency logs (public admin and mod logs)
- a little speed-up (voting takes long to get through)
body_html:
Yes we need a secret channel to plot the Broccoli culture war, but I don't see it as a priority compared to other things that take admin and dev bandwidth. Things like

  • customizable word lists so that users can be in control of their echo chambers
  • transparency logs (public admin and mod logs)
  • a little speed-up (voting takes long to get through)

body:
Discord itself bans a bunch of people and servers it doesn't like, so they have to enforce all kinds of crazy rules there. On top of that, the admins here refuse to communicate anything about moderation of the server with its users, including adding new mods. The only mods that exist where added during a massive influx of users and the admins had no choice. Now the admins still refuse to discuss any plans for the server with anyone except those few mods in their private mod channel. They also still refuse to welcome new mods, so that means now those < 10 current mods have total control and input on how the server is run and no one else even knows anything, let alone has a say. The current mods tried to get the admins to add other people who were interested in being a mod there but they've consistently refused.

I literally wasn't even in the server until 2 days ago and I've been hearing about this non-stop since /u/spez banned everything from reddit and triggered the influx here.

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body: You could still block any person. It's as private as a letter in the mail. The person getting the letter can show it whoever they want and you know that when you send the letter. If you're saying something in private that you wouldn't say or acknowledge in public, then you are censoring yourself.

If you're saying something in private that you wouldn't say or acknowledge in public, then you are censoring yourself.

parent.body: That does make some sense but I don't see how that system is superior to simply blocking unwanted messengers. Let's say I'm in a private discussion with someone on a controversial topic. I start to win the argument and my opponent, knowing that their point of view is the generally accepted viewpoint, decides to make the entire discussion public. Then I might be subject to harassment from a mob. And if someone is messaging you with things you find distasteful, what would be the point of allowing those messages to continue to reach you? If you find them unpleasant surely you would just want to make them stop.

I said the N letter with the Netflix logo at the same time as someone else was also sending the N letter so they just straight up banned both of us lmao. No warning, just ban. Kinda asinine without a good set of rules, if they don't want media uploads, they should disable it. It's like the admins have never used discord before or something and don't know how to disable all media. If it's against the rules to say the leter N, it should be clear. If it's against the rules to send a link of the netflix logo, they should disable all media. Not just this shit non-communication made up rules as we go along. Kinda retarded that I got banned without warning, I mean a kick wouldve sufficed and I woulda got the message, but what can ya do. Banned. 

That's why i wouldn't mind being able to create a chatroom/PM type of deal with select users on Ruqqus. 

I was in the server 2 days before the Reddit ban happened and the influx of users came.

- transparency logs (public admin and mod logs)
- a little speed-up (voting takes long to get through)

body:
I made that post. Yeah, they're usually very helpful otherwise but when it comes to anything having to do with the Discord for some reason they just troll anyone who has concerns about it. Seems like they don't think anyone besides the mods is welcome to give their input about the Discord server, and they don't even listen to those few mods a lot of the times (the biggest difference is they at least take them seriously). If you want unbanned or at least an answer try @AngstKitten, @Meguminnnn, or one of the mods instead, they're usually good about this.

It's just not like the admins to be like this imo, maybe there's more going on behind the scenes and Discord employees are actually mandating this strange new attitude about moderation and won't let the admins or mods tell anyone lest the server get deleted (which is probably inevitable at some point anyway). I know they've all been extremely paranoid about that happening so it's definitely possible.

body: To my recollection, what happened was I think I interpreted him to be concern trolling along with others for not only going off-topic but also trying to start n-word chains. I didn't know how the mod bot worked, so I said a few times and deleted these images and chains and intended for them to be warnings. Eventually I got fed up and kicked the lot, which when prompted, I left the reason box empty as I intended to inform the other mods of my actions. However, I guess someone had the same idea as me as they were apparently banned, and I was accused as I was the only mod on the chat. I checked the ban logs and they were there, along with a reason, which as I previously mentioned I did not put. I don't have audit log access either.

body:
If someone receives a distasteful letter in the post then they might show it to the police (admins). They might show it to a family member (a friend on Ruqqus or IRL, although I find this unlike and even more unlike that said friend harrases the sender). They almost certainly won't make it so that a hoard of strangers can view the letter. I don't think the analogy works.

>If you're saying something in private that you wouldn't say or acknowledge in public, then you are censoring yourself.

I'm sorry, but this is a really silly argument. It almost nullifies the concept of confiding in someone. Of course, I would say things in private that I wouldn't say in public. That's the point of privacy.

The fact is that private messaging of the type I describe achieves two things than yours doesn't:

1. Actual privacy
2. Accountability from authority (admins) rather than a mob

post.title: What are your thoughts on having a private messaging system, similar to Reddit?

body:
a dedicated PM & groupchat system would be great for not just moderator communications, but also for people that need to converse privately (eg. transactions, conversation, etc).

what also would be nice is an ability to make friend networks and send friend requests. it'd be a great way to help foster community.
body_html:
a dedicated PM & groupchat system would be great for not just moderator communications, but also for people that need to converse privately (eg. transactions, conversation, etc).

what also would be nice is an ability to make friend networks and send friend requests. it'd be a great way to help foster community.

author.bio: Texpat Software Engineer

body:
If they use ejabberd as the XMPP server, it would be possible to connect the chat user account with the ruqqus user account through the [multiple user authentication backends](https://docs.ejabberd.im/admin/configuration/authentication/), which is a win in my opinion.

Also, since it can be self-hosted, there's no more bending the knee to Discord.
body_html:
If they use ejabberd as the XMPP server, it would be possible to connect the chat user account with the ruqqus user account through the multiple user authentication backends, which is a win in my opinion.

Also, since it can be self-hosted, there's no more bending the knee to Discord.
